thread.title: Torchlight Parade might get some drizzle this year
thread.title_full: Torchlight Parade might get some drizzle this year

author: Jack Broom
title: Torchlight Parade might get some drizzle this year
text:
Torchlight Parade might get some drizzle this year Originally published July 24, 2015 at 7:33 pm Seafair’s Torchlight Parade comes with a chance of showers, with a temperature dropping from about 66 to 62 during the 7:30 p.m. event. By Jack Broom Seattle Times staff reporter 
Bring your jacket to the Seafair Torchlight Parade on Saturday evening, but don’t worry about a washout. 
After more than three weeks without measurable precipitation in the Seattle area, the Weather Service is forecasting a 30 percent chance of showers Saturday, but not a significant amount of rain. 
The temperature, expected to top out at about 70 degrees Saturday afternoon, is forecast to be about 66 when the parade on Fourth Avenue downtown starts at 7:30 p.m., and 62 when it ends at 10 p.m. 
Sunday is likely to be wetter, with a 60 percent chance of rain during the day and a 50 percent chance at night. About a tenth of an inch of rain is expected. Most Read Stories
